name: Kepler-350
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-350 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-350 is a star with 1.9849999999999994 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.53 times its radius. It is located 3208.69 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-350 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-350 b

Kepler-350 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.19 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-350.

The mass of Kepler-350 b is 4.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-350 b is 1.85 that of Earth. At 4.21 Earth masses, Kepler-350 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-350, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
